meanings.definition: The action or fact of joining or being joined.
meanings.sent1: The school celebrated the union of two clubs to create a new organization.
meanings.sent2: The union of the two rivers formed a larger waterway.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces were so happy to finally achieve union and complete the picture.
meanings.sent4: The union of flavors in the dish created a unique and delicious taste.
meanings.sent5: The union of the two families brought joy and harmony to all.

meanings.definition: A group of workers formed to protect their rights and interests.
meanings.sent1: The union negotiated better wages for the employees.
meanings.sent2: The workers decided to join the union to have a stronger voice.
meanings.sent3: The union picnic was filled with laughter and camaraderie.
meanings.sent4: The union of workers stood strong against unfair labor practices.
meanings.sent5: The union members supported each other like a big family.

meanings.definition: The state of being united or joined together.
meanings.sent1: The union of the two countries brought peace to the region.
meanings.sent2: The union of efforts led to a successful outcome.
meanings.sent3: The union of flavors in the recipe created a delightful dish.
meanings.sent4: The union of voices in the choir produced a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent5: The union of hearts symbolized their everlasting love.

meanings.definition: A political unit consisting of two or more states.
meanings.sent1: The European Union promotes cooperation among member countries.
meanings.sent2: The union of states formed a stronger alliance for defense.
meanings.sent3: The union of nations in the treaty was a significant diplomatic achievement.
meanings.sent4: The union of territories under one government brought stability to the region.
meanings.sent5: The union of provinces created a more cohesive and powerful nation.
